item.title: Illegal or Not Illegal
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“Dell451, post:58, topic:81557”]Private severs aren’t illegal because Runescape doesn’t look like them anymore, Actualy, I could never get online with Psevers, but I have the cleint on my computer, and me and my friends ding around with it, but I think that the Home Client, not the online one, is like looking into the past, what 3 years ago, when rs2 was fresh, private severs were a dream, and T.B.D. was all the talk, not Fally 666.

Edit: If somebody asks what T.B.D was(is) I won’t tell you, go bother somebody else about the Runescape(Classic) crack were a certain kid named ________ and some of his friends (sorry, asked not to put names here) on Nov. 7, 2003 found out about Item #s, you see, every item in Runescape, from a bronze dagger to a party hat, has an identification number. In duping, this ID# is copied, creating a multiple of the original item. For example, the ID# for a rune 2-handed sword is 81. When you are finished, the original sword and the duped sword will both have an ID# of 81. This way, Jagex cannot tell which items are duped and which are not, making it impossible to finding the doubles, Cause one of Rs most infamous days, Black Saturday,where millions of people lost, and gained, um…millions.

so there. Q’s? Google it.[/quote]

OMG ITEMZ HAS ID?
JAYGEX COPRITE DYES WHEN FOR THE CHNGE GRFX?

But seriously…wtf?
I’m sure that’s a factor in why Jagex doesn’t care about them very much, but that doesn’t make them legal.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Dell451 Dell451
item.description:
@Dell451 wrote:

Private severs aren’t illegal because Runescape doesn’t look like them anymore, Actualy, I could never get online with Psevers, but I have the cleint on my computer, and me and my friends ding around with it, but I think that the Home Client, not the online one, is like looking into the past, what 3 years ago, when rs2 was fresh, private severs were a dream, and T.B.D. was all the talk, not Fally 666.

Edit: If somebody asks what T.B.D was(is) I won’t tell you, go bother somebody else about the Runescape(Classic) crack were a certain kid named ________ and some of his friends (sorry, asked not to put names here) on Nov. 7, 2003 found out about Item #s, you see, every item in Runescape, from a bronze dagger to a party hat, has an identification number. In duping, this ID# is copied, creating a multiple of the original item. For example, the ID# for a rune 2-handed sword is 81. When you are finished, the original sword and the duped sword will both have an ID# of 81. This way, Jagex cannot tell which items are duped and which are not, making it impossible to finding the doubles, Cause one of Rs most infamous days, Black Saturday,where millions of people lost, and gained, um…millions.

so there. Q’s? Google it.

Read full topic

item.title: Illegal or Not Illegal
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

Uriko:

By the way, Mopar, you host the client jar’s right? That must some way be illegal, downloading, deob’ing, and uploading their code to your site.

It is. US Code Title 17, § 1201 - Circumvention of copyright protection systems. One of the lovely contributions the DMCA has made to our society. I know Jagex holds a US copyright on “Runescape: the official handbook” but I don’t remember if any of the software is protected.
Specifically:

(A) No person shall circumvent a technological measure that effectively controls access to a work protected under this title.
(3) As used in this subsection— (A) to “circumvent a technological measure” means [b]to descramble a scrambled work[/b], to decrypt an encrypted work, or otherwise to avoid, bypass, remove, deactivate, or impair a technological measure, without the authority of the copyright owner;

In the future, everyone who wants to talk about how Jagex “can’t touch us” because of some clever little trick needs to READ THE LAW. We are not doing anything that “fair use” is supposed to protect. This site still exists because Jagex doesn’t care enough to really attack it. Attacking a site like this isn’t necessarily easy, it’s just possible. I’m sure they’d have to pay their lawyers overtime (or hire another mole…/me glares at semaphore).

RuneScript was referred to in an interview a few years ago. Since then, everyone has assumed that it’s some kind of content scripting engine. The client - and for all we know, the server as well - was written in Java by a team of expert developers headed by Andrew Gower.

Read full topic

[/quote]And… where do you get any of this information?

By the way, Mopar, you host the client jar’s right? That must some way be illegal, downloading, deob’ing, and uploading their code to your site.[/quote]

No, I don’t host the client’s jars.
